terpenes.name: Limonene
terpenes.effects: Uplifting, stress relief, mood-boosting, energizing, creativity, happy
terpenes.funFact: Same terpene that gives citrus fruits their scent. Often used in cleaning products.
terpenes.notableStrains: Super Lemon Haze, Durban Poison, Wedding Cake, Sour Diesel, Tangie, Agent Orange, NYC Diesel, Gorilla Glue, Key Lime Pie

terpenes.name: Myrcene
terpenes.effects: Relaxing, sedative, anti-inflammatory, pain relief, couch-lock, sleepy
terpenes.funFact: Most common terpene in cannabis. Found in mangoes, which some say enhances a cannabis high.
terpenes.notableStrains: Granddaddy Purple, Blue Dream, OG Kush, Grape Ape, Mango Kush, Harlequin, Green Crack

terpenes.name: Alpha-Pinene
terpenes.effects: Focus, alertness, mental clarity, creativity
terpenes.funFact: Increases airflow and may help with asthma. Also found in pine needles, rosemary, and dill.
terpenes.notableStrains: Jack Herer, Trainwreck, Pineapple Express, Apple Jack, Sour Apple, Apple Fritter, Island Sweet Skunk, Romulan

terpenes.name: Beta-Caryophyllene
terpenes.effects: Anti-inflammatory, pain relief, relaxation, energizing, motivation
terpenes.funFact: Only terpene known to interact directly with CB2 receptors. Found in black pepper and cloves. Can act as an antioxidant.
terpenes.notableStrains: Girl Scout Cookies, Bubba Kush, Chemdawg, UK Cheese, Exodus Cheese, Blue Cheese, Chocolope, Ethiopian Coffee, Headband

terpenes.name: Linalool
terpenes.effects: Calming, anti-anxiety, mood enhancement, relaxation, stress relief, euphoria
terpenes.funFact: One of the main terpenes in lavender, used in aromatherapy for stress relief. Common in grapes, giving wine its aroma.
terpenes.notableStrains: LA Confidential, Zkittlez, Do-Si-Dos, Grape Ape, Lavender, Granddaddy Purple, Grape Kush, Wedding Cake, Ice Cream Cake, Gelato

terpenes.name: Geraniol
terpenes.effects: Euphoric, uplifting, sweet relaxation
terpenes.funFact: Bees produce geraniol to mark flowers. Commonly used in perfumes.
terpenes.notableStrains: Afghani, Headband, Sundae Driver, Honey Bananas, Rose Bud, Pink Kush, Red Dragon

terpenes.name: Humulene
terpenes.effects: Appetite suppressant, anti-inflammatory, sedative, heavy couch-lock
terpenes.funFact: Commonly found in hops and basil, giving beer its characteristic taste.
terpenes.notableStrains: Girl Scout Cookies, Skywalker OG, Death Star, Northern Lights, Headband

terpenes.name: Terpinolene
terpenes.effects: Uplifting, creative
terpenes.funFact: Found in sage and rosemary, known for its fresh aroma.
terpenes.notableStrains: Jack Herer, Dutch Treat, Ghost Train Haze

terpenes.name: Menthol
terpenes.effects: Cooling, soothing, refreshing
terpenes.funFact: Gives peppermint its cool effect.
terpenes.notableStrains: Thin Mint GSC, Peppermint Kush, Chernobyl

terpenes.name: Nerolidol
terpenes.effects: Sedating, relaxing
terpenes.funFact: Found in orange peels and ginger, known for its subtle woody scent.
terpenes.notableStrains: Jack Herer, Island Sweet Skunk, Sweet Skunk

terpenes.name: Ocimene
terpenes.effects: Uplifting, energizing
terpenes.funFact: Commonly found in mint and parsley, provides a sweet herbaceous aroma.
terpenes.notableStrains: Dutch Treat, Green Crack, Golden Goat

terpenes.name: Fenchol
terpenes.effects: Relaxing, anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, potential cognitive benefits
terpenes.funFact: Found in basil, Fenchol contributes to the fresh and slightly piney aroma.
terpenes.notableStrains: OG Kush, Banana Kush, Amnesia Haze

terpenes.name: Eucalyptol
terpenes.effects: Focus-enhancing, uplifting, anti-inflammatory, antibacterial
terpenes.funFact: Also known as cineole, it's widely used in cough drops and aromatherapy.
terpenes.notableStrains: Super Silver Haze, Headband, Girl Scout Cookies

terpenes.name: Valencene
terpenes.effects: Uplifting, energizing, antifungal, antioxidant, mood-enhancing
terpenes.funFact: Found in Valencia oranges. Used as a natural insect repellent.
terpenes.notableStrains: Agent Orange, Tangie, Sour Diesel, Clementine, Jillybean, Mimosa

terpenes.name: Guaiol
terpenes.effects: Calming, anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, potential pain relief
terpenes.funFact: Extracted from the guaiacum tree, commonly used in perfumes and medicine.
terpenes.notableStrains: Afghani, Golden Pineapple, Sour Diesel

terpenes.name: Isopulegol
terpenes.effects: Relaxing, potential anti-anxiety, anti-inflammatory, neuroprotective
terpenes.funFact: Precursor to menthol, giving peppermint its characteristic aroma.
terpenes.notableStrains: Harle-Tsu, Cannatonic, Cherry Wine

terpenes.name: Delta-3-Carene
terpenes.effects: Anti-inflammatory, promotes memory retention, may dry out mouth and eyes
terpenes.funFact: Often found in essential oils, particularly in cypress and pine.
terpenes.notableStrains: Jack Herer, Super Lemon Haze, Skunk #1

terpenes.name: Pulegone
terpenes.effects: Sedative, potential memory-boosting effects, stress relief
terpenes.funFact: Naturally occurs in pennyroyal and mint, commonly used in aromatherapy.
terpenes.notableStrains: Kush Mintz, White Widow, Grape Ape

terpenes.name: Cymene
terpenes.effects: Anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, antibacterial, may enhance mood
terpenes.funFact: Derived from thyme and cumin, often found in essential oils.
terpenes.notableStrains: Maui Wowie, Tangie, Orange Bud

terpenes.name: Farnesene
terpenes.effects: Calming, muscle relaxant, may help with sedation and anti-inflammation
terpenes.funFact: Contributes to the scent of green apples, found in many plants and fruits.
terpenes.notableStrains: GMO Cookies, Zkittlez, Cherry Pie

terpenes.name: Phytol
terpenes.effects: Sedative, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, potential anxiety relief
terpenes.funFact: A byproduct of chlorophyll breakdown, often found in green tea.
terpenes.notableStrains: Sour Diesel, Cheese, Blue Dream

terpenes.name: Camphor
terpenes.effects: Cooling, anti-inflammatory, potential respiratory benefits, uplifting
terpenes.funFact: Derived from the camphor tree, commonly used in medicine and chest rubs.
terpenes.notableStrains: White Widow, Super Silver Haze, OG Kush

terpenes.name: Borneol
terpenes.effects: Relaxing, potential pain relief, anti-inflammatory, sedative
terpenes.funFact: Used in Chinese medicine, believed to aid in pain relief and relaxation.
terpenes.notableStrains: Golden Goat, Blueberry, Trainwreck
